etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin plantago, plantagin-, from planta ‘sole of the foot’ (because of its broad prostrate leaves)

definitions: a low-growing plant that typically has a rosette of leaves and a slender green flower spike, widely growing as a weed in lawns.

notes.text: Genus Plantago, family Plantaginaceae: many species

shortDefinitions: low-growing plant that has rosette of leaves and slender green flower spike

etymologies: mid 16th century: from Spanish plá(n)tano, probably by assimilation of a South American word to the Spanish plá(n)tano ‘plane tree’

definitions: a banana containing high levels of starch and little sugar, which is harvested green and widely used as a cooked vegetable in the tropics.
shortDefinitions: banana containing high levels of starch and little sugar, which is harvested green and widely used as cooked vegetable in tropics

definitions: the plant that bears the plantain fruit.
